sen.j: 禖子内親王（ばいし（みわこ）ないしんのう、長暦3年8月19日_(旧暦)（1039年9月10日） - 嘉保3年9月13日_(旧暦)（1096年10月1日）は、後朱雀天皇の第四皇女。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Baishi (Miwako), September 10, 1039 - October 1, 1096, was the forth daughter of Emperor Gosuzaku.
Imperial Princess Baishi (Miwako), September 10, 1039 - October 1, 1096, was the forth daughter of Emperor Gosuzaku.
Imperial Princess Baishi (Miwako), September 16, 1039 - October 7, 1096, was the forth daughter of Emperor Gosuzaku.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。

sen.j: 母は中宮藤原げん子、同母姉に祐子内親王。
sen.e: Her mother was the Chugu (imperial consort) FUJIWARA no Genshi and Imperial Princess Yushi (Sukeko) was her uterine elder sister.
Her mother was the Chugu (imperial consort) FUJIWARA no Genshi and Imperial Princess Yushi (Sukeko) was her uterine elder sister.

She was the Saiin (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines), also known as the Rokujo Saiin.

sen.j: 誕生後わずか10日で母后嫄子が崩御した。
sen.e: Her mother Genshi died when Imperial Princess Baishi was only ten days old.

sen.j: 姉祐子内親王と共に祖父藤原頼通の元で育てられた。
sen.e: She and her elder sister, Imperial Princess Yushi were brought up by her grandfather FUJIWARA no Yorimichi.

sen.j: 永承元年（1046年）、兄後冷泉天皇の即位に伴い、8歳で賀茂斎院となる。
sen.e: In 1046, with the accession of Emperor Goreizei who was her elder brother, she become the Consecrated Princess of Kamo at the age of eight.

sen.j: 病弱のため康平元年（1058年）に斎院を退いた。
sen.e: In 1058 she retired from her office due to her poor health.

sen.j: その後も長く病に苦しんだが、一方で幼い頃から和歌の才能に優れていたといわれる。
sen.e: While she suffered from ailments long afterwards, she displayed a talent for poetry from an early age.

sen.j: 「天喜三年五月三日物語歌合」ほか、判明しているだけで25回もの歌合を開催した。
sen.e: She held twenty-five at least so far known poetic contests, including the "contest of romantic poetry on June 1, 1055."

sen.j: 斎院退下の後は、母方の曽祖父である具平親王の六条邸に住んだという。
sen.e: After her retirement she lived in the residence of Imperial Prince Tomohira, her maternal great grandfather.

sen.j: 晩年に出家、永長元年（1096年）58歳で死去。
sen.e: In her later years she became a priestess and died in 1096 at the age of fifty-eight.

sen.e: A poetess ROKUJO-SAIIN no Senji who served Imperial Princess Baishi was presumably the author of 'the Tale of Sagoromo.'
